Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit three sixes in the final eight balls to haul India over the line.
Hardik Pandya kept telling Kohli to believe in the final ball of the match.
Dinesh Karthik was stumped, but another wide to new batter Ravichandran Ashwin levelled the scores with a ball to play.
Ravichandran Ashwin hit the final ball over mid off to win the game for India.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his disbelief and stated that standing there felt like it was meant to be, calling it a very special moment.
The match was played out in front of a capacity crowd of 90,293 fervent supporters at the MCG.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan lost openers Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan early in the innings.
Iftikhar Ahmed and Shan Masood reset Pakistan's innings to reach 2-60 after 10 overs.
Shan Masood hit four of his next nine deliveries for a series of massive sixes, making 51 off 34 balls.
Pakistan's Shadab Khan, Haider Ali, Mohammad Nawaz, and Asif Ali fell in quick succession.
KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma departed for single-digit scores early in India's innings.
Suryakumar Yadav fell soon after, squeezed by a rising ball from Haris Rauf.
Axar Patel was given out despite a mess up in a routine run out.
Mohammad Rizwan messed up a routine run out but third umpire Richard Kettleborough ruled that the ball had broken the bails before his gloves did.
Mohammad Rizwan was not turning in celebration after breaking the stumps â€” but still got the decision.
